name: primal_in_the_mane
text: not to be confused with coprophagiac

name: genequagmire
text: Yes, this turkey liked to have sex with feces, not eat them.

name: lolsworth
text: Man that turkey would taste bad

name: epicurus
text: Actually many animals that subsist on excrement are considered delicious, strangely enough. Consider, for instance, the common Lobster, a shit-eating giant insect from the earth's festering asshole, which a man will pay $29 for without irony.

name: tsolless
text:
However, lobsters were originally sold ironically to rich people who lived far far away from the coast.

Prior to that there were laws passed to prevent prisons feeding inmates too much lobster as it was seen as cruel and unusual. Now, it's a commonly asked for last meal.

name: epicurus
text:
Indeed, the history of lobster richly illustrates the depths of human stupidity as this shit-obsessed hell-bug from Cthulhu's taint is sold to idiot inlanders who don't know better (following the invention of refrigeration). When these wealthy rubes develop a taste for shitbug, immediately it becomes high-class to eat this expensive horror from the deeps, and this status as 'rich people food' spreads back to the coasts, to those who should know better.

Now Lobster Ignorance covers most of the known world.

name: brosaurus
text: I wish I could chubby this far more than once for "shit-obsessed hell-bug from Cthulhu's taint".

name: soticoto
text: Y'know some species of Lobster could crush your hand clean off your wrist with one claw? They are the Nice Petes of the deep... and we can't abide that sort of arrogance. They are not eaten for their flavour, nor their shit-eating habits, but basically just a big Fuck You to these little terrorists of Dagon's realm.

name: aljazeera
text: Of course, the problem with the argument against these giant shit insects is that they are still delicious.

name: dusty
text: There is hardly a creature on earth that you could have a chef prepare with that much butter and not make it delicious.

name: epicurus
text:
A lobster is an expensive sponge, to be dabbed in melted fat.

A lobster is the Stone Soup of the modern age.

name: dissembly
text:
*Crustacean*... shit-eating giant *crustacean* from earth's festering asshole.

Crustaceans and insects have a long-standing feud, older even than that between farmers and herdsmen, which has resulted in them occupying different environments. There are very few crustaceans on land, and very few insects in saltwater. Those who cross this boundary, like the enterprising isopods known as 'slaters', are looked upon with some distrust by their brethren. Although we are all pretty open-minded here, one must be careful not to speak so loosely in mixed company. Deep prejudices are at work, and one must be sure not to offend.

name: epicurus
text: I call a lobster a giant insect in the same sense as you might insult a wolf by calling it an overgrown poodle. You know it's not really a poodle, but that's okay, because it conveys even more of your pure contempt.

name: anzio
text: Lobsters are among many creatures of the deep that make me glad they aren't massive and able to walk around on land, all mowin' us all down with them claws...

name: greenkoolayd
text: farm turkeys(as well as chickens) do often consume their own excrement.

name: robocop
text: like gg allin?

name: petitegitan
text: I was unaware that turkeys even came in these varieties!

name: whuppins
text: Had to Google for Prince Albert. Wished I hadn't.

name: hollis
text: Yeah... I looked it up on Wikipedia and my only thought was "ow."  And I'm not even a dude.

name: mortshire
text:
why did i do just what you did

whyyyyyyy

text: You people make me feel weird for already knowing this!!!

name: dorothypoopbot
text: Don't worry, you're not the only one.

name: rainwolfj
text: Want to get together and share knowledge of odd body piercings?

text:
HAY EVERYONE LOOK UP THE PRINCESS ALBERTINA!

... You can probably guess, anyhow.

name: rowboat
text:
I refuse to even guess. Watch me not guess.


toolate

name: rowboat
text: I'm not one of them.

name: carlyle
text: Hey! Three more things to Google! Thanks Assetbar.

name: carlyle
text: *hork*

name: invidious
text:
That phrase will be on your tombstone.

I will see to this.

name: mystkmanat
text:
i saw everyone's warnings, and still i repeated your mistakes! went straight to wikipedia... typed it in... began to read the article... noticed the picture. the large, close-up, detailed picture.

Thank you, wikipedia. you make life grand.

name: notgodot
text: I've got a PA and my pecker was pretty sore after I first got it. Actually getting it didn't really hurt so much. I mean there was a lot of blood at the time but it basically stung like getting an innoculation.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Bertie Wooster talking about having a Prince Albert is deeply disturbing, and man I can not imagine how that would not hurt while getting it, unless of course you had hella painkillers in your male member.

name: genequagmire
text: You meant hell of.

name: notgodot
text: Like I said man, it was like getting a needle when it was actually done, and then it was sore.

name: gunsofray
text: i did not want to know this. but i refuse to un-know this.

name: greenkoolayd
text: chicks get their clits pierced.  its approximately the same.

name: deusoma
text:
Agreed. First thought: "aaaawwwwwwaaaaaggggghhhhhh"
Or something to that effect. Also senseless terror, as if evil piercing gnomes might break into my home and force one on me now that I know it exists.

name: ford
text: hehe. you haven't lived until you've been to the sort of festivals where dudes with these pass you on the road, all swingin around.

name: saru
text: I would lame you but I'm too scared to.

name: semiquaver
text: Animated facial feature battle!

name: rowboat
text: Everybody else here had to look up what a Prince Albert is. I knew about that, but had to look up coprophilia. I think my search dealt me the worse end of the deal.

name: slalvation
text:
We are in the same boat.

D:

name: tronwell
text: is there room in there for one more? can we all huddle under a blanket?

name: semiquaver
text: I merely nodded knowingly at the alt-text and giggled at the concept of a turtle with such a piercing.  I need under the blanket most of all.  Is there a therapist amongst you perchance?

name: hedonismbot

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pseudochron, DanS, Zem, Eraia)

name: lateadopter
text:
I always thought that should be T-bone, and Onstad just never corrected the typo. Little did I know that prime rib normally includes the 6th through 12th ribs, or 7 bones. Onstad is the man with food on his mind.

Anyway, seven just makes sense for Ray. He's already had six bones .

name: rowboat
text:
How to know if you're too into Achewood: you don't have to follow that link. You know.

text: Nah, turkeys usually avoid piercings. Turtles, on the other hand, are well-known as party animals. Why do you think Philippe wants to go as one for Halloween?
